title: Jonathan Lethem - Novels, Short Stories & Essays (13 books)
description:
JONATHAN LETHEM (b. 1964) is an American novelist, essayist and short story writer.

His first novel, GUN, WITH OCCASIONAL MUSIC (1994), a genre work that mixed elements of science fiction and detective fiction.  It was followed by three more science fiction novels.  In 1999, Lethem published MOTHERLESS BROOKLYN, a National Book Critics Circle Award-winning novel that achieved mainstream success.  In 2003, the semi-autobiographical bildungsroman FORTRESS OF SOLITUDE became a New York Times Best Seller.

This collection contains a broad selection of Lethem's work, including all the published novels to date, a short story compilation, and two volumes of essays.  I have also included CONVERSATIONS WITH JONATHAN LETHEM, a collection of fourteen interviews, conducted over a decade and a half.


With the exception of CONVERSATIONS, which is PDF, all the books are in EPUB format:

* AMNESIA MOON (Harcourt Brace & Co., 1995)

* AS SHE CLIMBED ACROSS THE TABLE (Doubleday, 1997)

* CHRONIC CITY (Doubleday, 2009)

* CONVERSATIONS WITH JONATHAN LETHEM [Jaime Clarke, ed.] (University Press of Mississippi, 2011) -- PDF

* THE DISAPPOINTMENT ARTIST: Essays (Doubleday, 2005)

* DISSIDENT GARDENS (Doubleday, 2013)

* THE ECSTASY OF INFLUENCE: Nonfictions, etc. (Doubleday, 2011)

* THE FORTRESS OF SOLITUDE (Doubleday, 2003)

* GIRL IN LANDSCAPE (Doubleday, 1998)

* GUN, WITH OCCASIONAL MUSIC (Harcourt Brace & Co., 1994)

* MEN AND CARTOONS (Doubleday, 2004)

* MOTHERLESS BROOKLYN (Doubleday, 1999)

* YOU DON'T LOVE ME YET (Doubleday, 2007)
